result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan J Lyon

Clerk Deanna.
Case called:  10:22 am
Includes cases 14CF136, 14CF289, 13CM1374 and 13CM1421.
State appears by ADA Amanda Jadin.  Def appears with Atty Erik McFarland.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
14CF136:
Ct 1 (Intimidate Vic-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct 2 (Child Abuse-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct 3 (Criminal Damage-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct 4 (DC-Repeater)>>DRI
COURT GRANTS
PLEA:
14CF289:
Ct 1 (Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance-Repeater)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Deft makes statements.
COURT ORDERS:
14CF289:
Ct 1 (Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance-Repeater)>>SWH.  Probation for 3 years.  CONDITIONS:  AODA & any follow up, absolute sobriety, counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by agent, GFE at FTE/Schooling or a combo; if not, 5 hours community service per week if not in treatment, CC w/DNA surcharge, if Deft is successful with Probation, this may be expunged at the age of 25.
13CM1374:
Ct 1 (DC)>>TIME SERVED.  60 days MCJ; credit for 60 days, enter civil judgment for any unpaid financial obligations.
13CM1421:
Ct 2 (DC)>>TIME SERVED.  60 days MCJ; credit for 60 days, enter civil judgment for any unpaid financial obligations.

Adj:  10:35 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Status conference on May 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:44 am   
INCLUDES 14CF136 AND 14CF289. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for Amanda Jadin; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Erik McFarland. 
OTR: 9:45 am BOTR: 9:47 am 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 14CF289. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

Information to be filed within 30 days.

Officer Jerrick Alsteen (Wausau PD) sworn and testifies - identifies deft.  
State rests. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information to filed within 30 days. 
Bond continues.
